pyquanttrade

Functions¶

Functions to create strategies.

All of the functions return a programatic function which calculates the given function for some OCHL data.

To build a function not included in the package, use the following template:

def function_name(params, target='close'):
    def return_function(data):
        your code goes here
    return return_function
line(value)¶

Line which can be used to cross with functions like RSI or MACD. Name: line_*value*

Parameters

value (float) – Value of the line

days_to_constant(days, order=1)¶

Calculates the constant for exponential smoothing from a given window size

Parameters

  • days (int) – Window size

  • order (int, optional) – [description], defaults to 1

trailing(target='close', days=40, over_under='under')¶

Calculates the if the target is trailing under or over the current in the past days.

Parameters

  • target (str) – Data column to use for the calculation, defaults to “close”

  • days (int) – Size of the window in days, defaults to 40

rolling_std(days, target='close')¶

Calculates the rolling standard deviation

Parameters

  • days (int) – Size of the window in days

  • target (str, optional) – Data column to use for the calculation, defaults to “close”

moving_average(days, target='close')¶

Calculates the rolling moving average

Parameters

  • days (int) – Size of the window in days

  • target (str, optional) – Data column to use for the calculation, defaults to “close”

weighted_moving_average(days, weights)¶

Calculates the rolling weighted moving average. The weights list should have the size of the days window.

Parameters

  • days (int) – Size of the window

  • weights (list(int)) – Weights to use for the calculation

step_weighting_ma(days, first_weight=1, step=1)¶

Calculates the weighted moving average using stepped weights

Parameters

  • days (int) – Window size

  • first_weight (int, optional) – Weight of the first data point, defaults to 1

  • step (int, optional) – Weight increment for each data point, defaults to 1

percentage_weighting_ma(days, last_weight=1, step=0.5)¶

Calculates the weighted moving average using backwards set weights. F.e. for a given last days=3, weight=1, step=0.5, the wieghts would be [0.25, 0.5, 1]

Parameters

  • days (int) – Window size

  • last_weight (int, optional) – Weights of the last data point, defaults to 1

  • step (float, optional) – Weight multiplier for each previous data point, defaults to 0.5

triangular_weighting_ma(days=10, shape='linear')¶

Calculates the weighted moving average with the weights having a triangular shape

Parameters

  • days (int, optional) – Window size, defaults to 10

  • shape (str, optional) – Type of shape. Can be “linear” or “gaussian” , defaults to “linear”

geometric_moving_average(days, target='close')¶

Calculates the geometric moving average

Parameters

  • days (int) – Window size

  • target (str, optional) – Data column to use, defaults to “close”

exponential_smoothing(constant, target='close')¶

Calculates the exponential smoothing

Parameters

  • constant (float) – Smoothing constant for the calculation. Use function days_to_constant

  • target (str, optional) – Data column to use, defaults to “close”

second_order_exponential_smoothing(constant)¶

Calculates the second order exponential smoothing of close

Parameters

constant (float) – Smoothing constant for the calculation. Use function days_to_constant

third_order_exponential_smoothing(constant)¶

Calculates the second order exponential smoothing of close

Parameters

constant (float) – Smoothing constant for the calculation. Use function days_to_constant

double_moving_average(days)¶

Calculates the double moving average of close

Parameters

days (int) – Window size

double_smoothed_momentum(days1, days2)¶

Calculates the momentum, smoothed by two consecutive exponential smoothings

Parameters

  • days1 (int) – First smoothing window size

  • days2 (int) – Second smoothing window size

hull_moving_average(period=16, target='close')¶

Calculates the hull moving average

Parameters

  • period (int, optional) – Window size, defaults to 16

  • target (str, optional) – Data colum to use, defaults to “close”

upper_keltner_channel(days=10)¶

Calculates the upper keltner channel

Parameters

days (int, optional) – Window size, defaults to 10

lower_keltner_channel(days=10)¶

Calculates the lower keltner channel

Parameters

days (int, optional) – Window size, defaults to 10

upper_percentage_band(c, band_target, center_target)¶

Calculates the upper percentage band

Parameters

  • c (float) – multiplier constant

  • band_target (str) – Data column used for the band displacement

  • center_target (str) – Data column used for the center of the channel

lower_percentage_band(c, band_target, center_target)¶

Calculates the lower percentage band

Parameters

  • c (float) – multiplier constant

  • band_target (str) – Data column used for the band displacement

  • center_target (str) – Data column used for the center of the channel

upper_absolute_band(value, target)¶

Calculates the upper absolute band

Parameters

  • value (float) – Constant for band displacement

  • target (str) – Data column for the center of the band

lower_absolute_band(value, target)¶

Calculates the lower absolute band

Parameters

  • value (float) – Constant for band displacement

  • target (str) – Data column for the center of the band

upper_bollinger_band(mean_days, std_days, c)¶

Calculates the upper bollinger band

Parameters

  • mean_days (int) – Window size for the band center

  • std_days (str) – Window size for the band displacement

  • c (float) – Multiplier constant

lower_bollinger_band(mean_days, std_days, c)¶

Calculates the lower bollinger band

Parameters

  • mean_days (int) – Window size for the band center

  • std_days (str) – Window size for the band displacement

  • c (float) – Multiplier constant

upper_volatility_band(c, dev_target, band_target, center_target)¶

Calculates the upper volatility band

Parameters

  • c (float) – Multiplier constant

  • dev_target (function or float) – Used for band displacement. Can be a constant or a function

  • band_target (function or float) – Used for band displacement. Can be a constant or a function

  • center_target (str) – Data column for the band center

lower_volatility_band(c, dev_target, band_target, center_target)¶

Calculates the lower volatility band

Parameters

  • c (float) – Multiplier constant

  • dev_target (function or float) – Used for band displacement. Can be a constant or a function

  • band_target (function or float) – Used for band displacement. Can be a constant or a function

  • center_target (str) – Data column for the band center

momentum(days=1, target='close')¶

Calculates the momentum

Parameters

  • days (int, optional) – Window size, defaults to 1

  • target (str, optional) – Data column to use, defaults to “close”

momentum_percentage(days=1, target='close')¶

Calculates the momentum as a percentage

Parameters

  • days (int, optional) – Window size, defaults to 1

  • target (str, optional) – Data colum to use, defaults to “close”

MACD_line(slow_trend=26, fast_trend=12)¶

Calculates the MACD line

Parameters

  • slow_trend (int, optional) – Slow window size, defaults to 26

  • fast_trend (int, optional) – Fast window size, defaults to 12

MACD_signal(signal, slow_trend=26, fast_trend=12)¶

Calculates the MACD signal

Parameters

  • signal (int) – Exponential smoothing window size of the MACD line

  • slow_trend (int, optional) – Slow window size of MACD line, defaults to 26

  • fast_trend (int, optional) – Fast windown size of MACD line, defaults to 12

MACD_histogram(signal, slow_trend=26, fast_trend=12)¶

Calculates the MACD histogram

Parameters

  • signal (int) – Exponential smoothing window size of the MACD line

  • slow_trend (int, optional) – Slow window size of MACD line, defaults to 26

  • fast_trend (int, optional) – Fast windown size of MACD line, defaults to 12

divergence_index(slow_trend, fast_trend)¶

Calculates the divergence index

Parameters

  • slow_trend (int) – Slow window size

  • fast_trend (int) – Fast window size

average_true_range(days=10, target='close')¶

Calculates the average true range

Parameters

  • days (int, optional) – Window size, defaults to 10

  • target (str, optional) – Data column to use, defaults to “close”

stochastic_percentageK(days)¶

Calculates the stochastic K

Parameters

days (int) – Window size

stochastic_percentageD(days, daysK)¶

Calculates the stochastic D

Parameters

  • days (int) – Window size

  • daysK (int) – Window size for the stochastic K

ADoscillator()¶

Calculates the A/D oscillator

percentageR(days)¶

Calculates the stochastic R

Parameters

days (int) – Window size

RSI(days)¶

Calculates the RSI

Parameters

days (int) – Window size

special_k()¶

Calculates the special k indicator
